summary: I am a responsible self-starter who communicates well and is dedicated to providing great customer service and staff support. I am comfortable working autonomously or in a team-based setting. I am both calm and focused, great at prioritizing, completing multiple tasks simultaneously and following through to achieve project goals.
skills: Microsoft Office: Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook

experience.title: Domestic Violence Counselor Advocate
experience.description: Provide domestic violence counseling, education, advocacy and support for staff and clients; crisis intervention, trauma-informed care, preventative services, and support services; assess danger and safety planning; assist victims to access emergency shelter; provide weekly domestic violence education classes; accompany and advocate for clients in Juvenile Dependency and/or Superior Court; link victims with resources in their community; attend Risk Assessment Meetings (RAMs) and Team Decision Making meetings (TDMs); follow-up and document outcomes; present yearly workshops and training; develop brochures and written materials, and maintain daily service logs, case notes, intakes, referral outcome reports and monthly summaries.

experience.title: Shelter Hotline Advocate
experience.description: Graveyard shift; crisis intervention over the phone and in person; shelter intakes; supervise shelter operations overnight; ensure residents follow house rules; teach independent living skills; assist with medication, first aid, hygiene products or transporting clients to the ER as needed; document behavior and needs; maintain hotline reports and close client files; train new staff, interns and volunteers.

experience.title: Domestic Violence Counselor Advocate
experience.description: Started as Administrative Assistant, then advocate; crisis intervention; facilitated support groups and life skills; managed day-to-day operations of the outreach center (2009-2011); coordinated with local organizations for food pantry; conducted fundraising events; trained new hires and volunteers; presented at state mandated domestic violence trainings.

experience.title: Administrative Assistant
experience.description: Answered and screened a heavy volume of calls; handled billing and invoicing; accounts receivable and collections; coordinated LTL shipping; prepared import documentation; created daily reports, spreadsheets, and payable verification; maintained office operations and trained new staff.

experience.title: Administrative Assistant
experience.description: Conducted I-9 reviews, drug tests, reference and criminal background checks; maintained client and employee data; performed clerical duties; scheduled and conducted interviews; followed up with clients and employees; managed accounts receivable/payable; created and maintained the agency's website.

certifications: State Mandated Domestic Violence Training (conducted 2 times a year)
